Countless temples across Golarion, dedicated to deities both living and forgotten, have risen and fallen through the ages. Many find themselves buried under sand, snow, or vine never to be found. In such places, the spirits of the faithful can bind with their ruined temple to form a guardian construct, though with nothing left to guard, these spirits often become hollow, resentful, and filled with malice. These “desecrated guardians” lie in wait, sometimes for centuries, and destroy any adventurers who happen upon them. The most powerful desecrated guardians, such as the one presented here, incorporate the structures of multiple temples into their massive serpentine forms. **[Recall Knowledge - Construct](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4)): DC 43 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 41 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38 [Desecrated Guardian](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1412) **Source** [Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain](/Sources.aspx?ID=87) pg. 80 **Perception** +30; [lifesense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=21) 60 feet **Languages** **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +35, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +31 **Str** +10 **Dex** +6 **Con** +9 **Int** -5 **Wis** +5 **Cha** -5 --- **AC** 42 **Fort** +36 **Ref** +31 **Will** +25 **HP** 360 **Immunities** [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27), [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [doomed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=9), [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10), [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15), [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) **Resistances** physical 15 (except [adamantine](/Equipment.aspx?ID=374)) **Weaknesses** good 15 **Desecration Aura** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [abjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=2), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64)) 40 feet. Desecrated guardians exude a palpable malice that nauseates all but the most wicked passersby. Non-evil creatures that enter the aura must attempt a DC 37 Will save. On a failure, the creature becomes [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) (sickened 2 on a critical failure). In addition, any non-evil creatures that attempt to Cast a Spell within the aura must succeed at a DC 5 flat check or the spell is lost.
**[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** Tail only. --- **Speed** 40 feet, climb 40 feet **Melee** jaws +35 ([deadly 3d12](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d10+22 bludgeoning plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27) **Melee** tail +35 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d8+20 bludgeoning plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27) **Avalanche** The desecrated guardian thrashes its body about, causing the nearby terrain to crumble and crash down on creatures in a 60-foot cone, dealing 12d10 bludgeoning damage (DC 42 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). It can't use Avalanche again for 1d4 rounds. **Coiled Rockslide** If the desecrated guardian started its turn [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22), it can Trample and remain hidden until after its attacks. **[Constrict](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=10)** 2d8+18 bludgeoning, DC 39 **Rebuild** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [healing transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=89)) The desecrated guardian draws in rubble from the surrounding area to rebuild its damaged body. It recovers 8d6 Hit Points. It can only use this ability if it is near suitable rock or rubble. **[Swallow Whole](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=35)** ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) Huge, 3d8+20 bludgeoning, Rupture 45 **[Trample](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=39)** Huge or smaller, tail, DC 37
Desecrated Temples Many of the temples that dot the peaks of the Wall of Heaven lay abandoned or in complete ruin. The magic in some of these places lives on, corrupted by time, decay, and the nightmarish extraplanar powers of Leng often found at Golarion's highest altitudes. There are dark tales of adventurers seeking refuge within a lone temple along the Wall of Heaven only to meet a terrible death at the hands of the temple's desecrated guardian. Although granting hospitality to strangers is a tenet of many Wall of Heaven temples, stories of monstrosities in disguise give some climbers pause as they approach a potential sanctuary.
name: Desecrated Guardian
